intro: Tanacetum pulverulentum subsp. pseudopulverulentum, commonly known as the pale yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in alpine or rocky environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural use in dry, sunny gardens.
